page.title: 02St. Mary's Church, Tamerton
page.content: The church has almost been destroyed by fire six times. The last time was in 1981. It was noticed by a passing motor cyclist. The roof of the church was on fire. When the firemen arrived they let the fire burn. The vicar asked the firemen why they were not putting out the flames. He was told that it would make the flames go down into the building and cause more damage. After several hours the fire was brought under control. There are a series of carved wooden roof bosses. Those in the nave and south aisle are thought to be of 15th century origin and a number of them show a face or head with leafy stems growing out of the mouth. The disastrous fire which destroyed the roof of the nave and much of the roof in 1981 miraculously did not seriously damage the bosses.
